michelle.goal: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that all participants can attend.

steven.goal: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that all participants can attend.

jerry.goal: Schedule a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that all participants can attend.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem compatible with FastDownwards that schedules a one hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for Michelle, Steven, and Jerry.

public_information: Work hours are 09:00 to 17:00 on Monday.
There exists at least one solution that fits all participants' existing schedules.

report.system_prompt: You are Michelle and you know your calendar for Monday. Provide your available time intervals within work hours for a 60 minute meeting based only on your private information. Use 24-hour HH:MM format and return either a list of available start times or intervals. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is michelle. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->michelle->private_information} This is the goal: {agents->michelle->goal} Provide your availability as a JSON list of available start times or intervals that fit a 60 minute meeting.

report.system_prompt: You are Steven and you know your calendar for Monday. Provide your available time intervals within work hours for a 60 minute meeting based only on your private information. Use 24-hour HH:MM format and return either a list of available start times or intervals. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is steven. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->steven->private_information} This is the goal: {agents->steven->goal} Provide your availability as a JSON list of available start times or intervals that fit a 60 minute meeting.

report.system_prompt: You are Jerry and you know your calendar for Monday. Provide your available time intervals within work hours for a 60 minute meeting based only on your private information. Use 24-hour HH:MM format and return either a list of available start times or intervals. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is jerry. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->jerry->private_information} This is the goal: {agents->jerry->goal} Provide your availability as a JSON list of available start times or intervals that fit a 60 minute meeting.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at producing PDDL domain and problem files compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Using the participants' reported availabilities, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode scheduling a 60 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for michelle, steven, and jerry. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the encoding is compatible with FastDownwards and keep actions for different participants distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive availability reports: {availability_michelle}, {availability_steven}, {availability_jerry}. Use them to construct a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that schedule a 60 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that is feasible for all participants. Keep agent actions distinct and produce final domain and problem enclosed in <domain> and <problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
